questions.explanation:
Meteorologist.

	Red Orange Yellow Green Blue Indigo Violet- the colors, in order, of the rainbow.

Music teacher.

	They are the notes which fall on the lines in the treble clef.

questions.text: King Phillip came over from great Scotland.
questions.explanation:
Zoologist.

	The order of scientific nomenclature- Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species.

questions.text: Please excuse my dear Aunt Sally.
questions.explanation:
Mathematician.

	The order of mathematical operations- Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction.

questions.text: My very educated mother just sent us nine pickles.  (Accurate 1930-2006.)
questions.explanation:
Astronomer.

	The planets, from nearest to farthest from the Sun - Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto.  In 2006, a new definition of what defines a planet, as opposed to any of the other objects orbiting our sun, led to the reclassification of Pluto as a dwarf planet.

questions.text: Bad beer rots our young guts, but vodka goes well.
questions.explanation:
Electrician.

	The order of color bands and their values on a resistor, from smallest to largest- Black, Brown, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Violet, Gray, White.

Geographer.

	The Great Lakes, in order of size- Superior, Huron, Michigan, Erie, Ontario.

questions.text: Really sick children must take no exercise.
questions.explanation:
Pediatrician.

	This one is clever! It describes on what day after infection the rash of some common childhood diseases appears. Day 1-Rubella. Day 2- Smallpox and scarlet fever. Day 3- Chickenpox. Day 4- Measles. Day 5- Typhus. Day 6- Nothing. Day 7- Enteric fever.

Cartographer.

	The directions on a map, in order- North East South West.

Anatomist.

	The branches of the facial nerve- temporal, zygomatic, buccal, marginal mandibular and cervical.
